newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks claw higher after seesaw trade.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks claw higher after seesaw trade.

text.p: Tokyo stocks clawed higher by the end of Friday trade after a day in which indices seesawed, lifted by bargain-hunting and depressed by profit-taking, brokers said.
They said most investors were still wary after the Nikkei average plunged below the 19,000 threshold at one stage on Thursday.
The Nikkei 225 settled 77.46 points or 0.40 percent higher at 19,369.04. Its March futures climbed 130 points to end at 19,400.
"Some shares that were looking a bit oversold rebounded and buying of global issues, especially by pension funds, helped the Nikkei average end on a firm tone," one analyst said.
